pullRequest.body:
This is a substantial step on the way to PNT and Dirichlet's Theorem: it adds the fact that the L-function of a Dirichlet character does not vanish on the closed right half-plane `Re(s) ≥ 1`.

From [EulerProducts](https://github.com/MichaelStollBayreuth/EulerProducts).

See [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/144837-PR-reviews/topic/Prerequisites.20for.20PNT.20and.20Dirichlet's.20Thm/near/482385971) on Zulip.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [b38e01e80e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19043/commits/b38e01e80e855e149c6f8c65ce406bd1268d5ddc)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LSeries.Nonvanishing`|2397|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LFunctionTrivChar_isBigO_near_one_horizontal`
`+ LFunction_isBigO_horizontal`
`+ LFunction_isBigO_horizontal_of_eq_zero`
`+ Lfunction_ne_zero_of_one_le_re`
`+ Lfunction_ne_zero_of_re_eq_one`
`+ norm_LFunction_product_ge_one`
`+ norm_LSeries_product_ge_one`
`+ riemannZeta_ne_zero_of_one_le_re`
`+ summable_neg_log_one_sub_mul_prime_cpow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>

> Here are some comments. Didn't quite get to the end (my train is about to arrive).
> 
> General remark on the end: is it worth having separate lemmas for the specific non-vanishing at `s = 1` as well as the general `re s = 1` statement?

@loefflerd Thanks! It is amazing how much room for improvement there still is :smile: 

If you think it makes sense having a separate lemma for the special case `s = 1`, I can of course easily add it. Do you have some specific use case in mind?

Here are some comments. Didn't quite get to the end (my train is about to arrive).

General remark on the end: is it worth having separate lemmas for the specific non-vanishing at `s = 1` as well as the general `re s = 1` statement?

Here are some comments. Didn't quite get to the end (my train is about to arrive).

General remark on the end: is it worth having separate lemmas for the specific non-vanishing at `s = 1` as well as the general `re s = 1` statement?
I think we don't need two separate files for the non-quadratic and quadratic result; we should delete the `QuadraticNonvanishing` file and move its contents to here.
OK, but this is probably better done in a separate follow-up PR.

alternative:
```suggestion
  rw [← ((hasSum_re <| hasSum_taylorSeries_neg_log hac₀).mul_left 3).add
    ((hasSum_re <| hasSum_taylorSeries_neg_log hac₁).mul_left 4) |>.add
    (hasSum_re <| hasSum_taylorSeries_neg_log hac₂) |>.tsum_eq]
```

```suggestion
  · simp only [pow_zero, Nat.cast_zero, div_zero, mul_zero, one_re, mul_one, add_zero, le_refl]
```
Our old friend `CharP.cast_eq_zero` ...

alternative (not clear if it's actually better):
```suggestion
    convert (show 0 ≤ 2 * a ^ n * ((z ^ n).re + 1) ^ 2 by positivity) using 1
    ring
```
It saves a line is certainly not worse.

better:
```suggestion
  · simp only [MulChar.map_nonunit _ hn', zero_mul, sub_zero, log_one, neg_zero, zero_re, mul_zero,
      neg_add_rev, add_zero, pow_two, le_refl]
```

```suggestion
    simpa only [norm_mul, norm_natCast_cpow_of_re_ne_zero _ <| re_neg_ne_zero_of_one_lt_re hs]
      using mul_le_of_le_one_left (by positivity) (χ.norm_le_one _)
```

```suggestion
    · simp only [ofReal_cpow n.cast_nonneg (-x), ofReal_natCast, ofReal_neg] 
```
If you hover over the lemma name, the docstring is displayed with the latex un-processed, so I think using unicode text would be better.
Will do.

golf:
```suggestion
  simpa only [neg_add_rev, neg_re, mul_neg, χ.pow_apply' two_ne_zero, ge_iff_le, add_re, one_re,
    ofReal_re, ofReal_add, ofReal_one] using
      tsum_nonneg fun (p : Nat.Primes) ↦ χ.re_log_comb_nonneg p.prop.two_le h₀ y
```

using transitivity and reflexivity together is redundant!
```suggestion
    exact ((isBigO_mul_iff_isBigO_div eventually_mem_nhdsWithin).mp <| H.isBigO_one ℂ)
```

```suggestion
      · simpa only [tendsto_iff_comap, Homeomorph.coe_addLeft, add_zero, map_le_iff_le_comap] using
          ((Homeomorph.addLeft (1 : ℂ)).map_punctured_nhds_eq 0).le
```

```suggestion
      · simp only [Function.comp_def, add_sub_cancel_left]
```

```suggestion
    have H : Tendsto (fun w ↦ w * LFunctionTrivChar N (1 + w)) (𝓝[≠] 0)
        (𝓝 <| ∏ p ∈ N.primeFactors, (1 - (p : ℂ)⁻¹)) := by
```
(always use an even indent depth)

```suggestion
    exact (isBigO_mul_iff_isBigO_div eventually_mem_nhdsWithin).mp <| H.isBigO_one ℂ
```

pullRequest.title: feat(NumberTheory/LSeries/Nonvanishing): new file
